title: Create PV and PVC for content group
content:
When your Persistent Volumes (PVs) for content groups are used up, follow the steps below to manually create them based on your deployment.

Dynamic volume provisioning

If you are using dynamic volume provisioning, you don't need to manually create PVs.

Static volume provisioning

If you are using static volume provisioning, follow these steps to create PVs.

  1. Run the following commands on the NFS host: 
    $CDF_HOME/scripts/setupNFS.sh <NFS>/itsma/itsma-smarta-saw-con-n
$CDF_HOME/scripts/setupNFS.sh <NFS>/itsma/itsma-smarta-saw-con-a-n

    For example,

    $CDF_HOME/scripts/setupNFS.sh /var/vols/itom/itsma/itsma-smarta-saw-con-6
$CDF_HOME/scripts/setupNFS.sh /var/vols/itom/itsma/itsma-smarta-saw-con-a-6
    The NFS parent export path varies based on your actual environment so the paths in the above example may not be followed. Make sure the same paths are used at all steps on this page.
  2. Copy the content below as a YAML file and modify it based on your actual environment: 
    apiVersion: v1
kind: PersistentVolume
metadata:
  name: <namespace>-itsma-smarta-saw-con-n
  labels:
    pv_pvc_label: saw-con-n
spec:
  accessModes:
  - ReadWriteOnce
  capacity:
    storage: 1Mi
  nfs:
    path: /var/vols/itom/itsma/itsma-smarta-saw-con-n
    server: ${NFS_server_host_name}
  persistentVolumeReclaimPolicy: Retain
  storageClassName: itom-fast
  volumeMode: Filesystem
---
apiVersion: v1
kind: PersistentVolume
metadata:
  name: <namespace>-itsma-smarta-saw-con-a-n
  labels:
    pv_pvc_label: saw-con-a-n
spec:
  accessModes:
  - ReadWriteOnce
  capacity:
    storage: 1Mi
  nfs:
    path: /var/vols/itom/itsma/itsma-smarta-saw-con-a-n
    server: ${NFS_server_host_name}
  persistentVolumeReclaimPolicy: Retain
  storageClassName: itom-fast
  volumeMode: Filesystem


    For example, create a YAML file named saw-con-6.yaml as below:

  3. Run the following command to create a new PV for content groups:

    kubectl create -f xxx.yaml

    For example, kubectl create -f saw-con-6.yaml

  4. Run the following command on a control plane node or a bastion node to get the PVC status:

    kubectl get pvc -n <namespace> | grep saw-con

    The PV and PVC are created successfully if the status of the new PVC is Bound.
